title: Strong Correlation of PROMIS Upper Extremity and Shoulder Arthroplasty Smart Score to ...

summary.text: PROMIS UE and SAS scores showed excellent correlation with ASES in evaluating upper extremity function post shoulder arthroplasty, indicating their effectiveness as sensitive alternatives to legacy measures.
Both PROMIS UE and SAS demonstrated low ceiling effects, suggesting they can accurately assess a broad range of functional outcomes in patients who have undergone shoulder arthroplasty.
The study supports the clinical utility of incorporating PROMIS UE and SAS into patient-centered outcome assessments for primary shoulder arthroplasty populations.
